child_font_files.name: Child Font Files
child_font_files.description: The list of file names for the font files that make up a composite font. See also `composite`, `font_face`.

font_face.name: Font Face
font_face.description: The name of the typeface, i.e. the specific weight or instance of the fontFamily. For example: Bold, Italic

font_family.name: Font Family
font_family.description: Complete collection of typefaces in different weights and classifications, but having the same point size, and designed to work together. For example, a Times Roman font family may include Times Roman Bold, Times Roman Extra Bold, Times Roman Italic, Times Roman Bold Italic, Times Roman Condensed, etc., all in the same size.

font_file_name.name: Font File Name
font_file_name.description: The font file name (not a complete path). For example: `Times New Roman.otf`. Some products are not storing file extension information. XMP spec is open about specifics of the file name. If font information is stored in multiple files, use the semicolon separator to store file names. For example: `zx___.mmm; zx__.pfm`

font_name.name: Font Name
font_name.description: PostScript name of the font. For example: `TimesNewRomanPS-BoldItalicMT`. font_name is manadatory to identify the font used in an asset but an asset may not have a `font` property if it has only images/vector arts (no text).

font_type.name: Font Type
font_type.description: The font type, such as TrueType, Type 1, OpenType, and so on. `font_type` is manadatory to identify font category but an asset may not have a `font` property if it has only images/vector arts (no text).

version_string.description: The Adobe CoolType font engine allows two fonts with the same PostScript name and different technologies to be used at the same time, but not if they are from different versions. So even without this data for a given document you will have unique font data. However, the version can tell you if the font has changed metrics, glyph forms or other important information. This is useful for comparing fonts in two documents or fonts in a document to those in your system.
